gurmukhi: ਧੰਨਿ ਧੰਨਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੁਨਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਭੲੇ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮਨਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮਨ ਮਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Dhanni Dhanni Gursikh Souni Gursikh Bhaay , Gursikh Mani Gursikh Man Maanay Hai ?
translation: Blessed is he who accepting Guru's advice become his disciple (devotee). In the process his mind is reassured in the True Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਭਾੲਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਭਾੳੁ ਚਾੳੁ ਰਿਦੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਜਾਨਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਜਗ ਜਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gursikh Bhaai Gursikh Bhaau Chaau Ridai , Gursikh Jaani Gursikh Jag Jaanay Hai ?
translation: By accepting his (Guru's) teachings with faith, love and enthusiasm develops in the heart of a devotee. He who labours on the teachings of Guru with singular mind, becomes known as a true Sikh of the Guru the world over.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੰਧਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪੂਰਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਪਹਚਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gursikh Sandhi Milai Gursikh Pooran Hui , Gursikh Pooran Braham Pahachaanay Hai ?
translation: The union of Guru and his Sikh by virtue of strenuous meditation on Lord's name that enables him practice Guru's teachings sincerely and adeptly, the Sikh then recognises the complete Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਨੇਮ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਿਖ ਗੁਰ ਸੋਹੰ ਸੋੲੀ ਬੀਸ ੲਿਕੀਸ ੳੁਰਿ ਅਾਨੇ ਹੈ ||੧੪੯||
transliteration: Gursikh Praym Naym Gursikh Sikh Gur , Sohan Soee Bees Ikees Uri Aanay Hai ?149?
translation: The sincerity of the Sikh in labouring on the teachings of his Guru brings both together to the extent of becoming one. Believe it! By repeated incantations of Waheguru, Waheguru (Lord) and Tuhi Tuhi (He alone, He alone), he lodges the Lord in his heart.
